message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.DC

The paper discusses a practical method for dynamic batch size adaptation in the context of large-scale empirical risk minimization, specifically for training neural networks. This falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) and computer vision (cs.CV). The paper also mentions the use of the proposed method on image classification benchmarks, which further supports the relevance to computer vision. Additionally, the paper involves optimization techniques (cs.DC) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) in the form of neural networks. Finally, the paper discusses the relationship between batch size and learning rate, which is a common topic in neural network optimization (cs.NE).
